text: I accidentally boarded the wrong streetcar and ended up on the other side of the city. Spent an extra hour trying to find my way back.
I tried to impress a date by suggesting a rooftop bar, but it was under construction. We ended up at a dingy dive instead.
I spilled my coffee on the subway and had to apologize to a stranger who got soaked too.
I got stuck in an elevator at CN Tower with my ex. It was awkward to the max.
I forgot my umbrella on a rainy day and soaked myself walking from the subway station.
I accidentally waved at someone who wasn't actually waving at me. Now I feel so embarrassed.
I went to a Kensington Market date and realized I had spinach stuck in my teeth the entire time.
I got caught singing loudly to my favorite song on the GO train when the doors opened.
I wore white shoes to a Toronto Raptors game and they got ruined by spilled drinks. So disappointing.
I took a selfie with a beaver in High Park, but the beaver swiped my phone right off my hand.
I tried to skateboard along the PATH and ended up on the emergency stairs after a bad fall.
I accidentally sent a message complaining about a date to the date themselves. Now it's really awkward.
I got locked out of my apartment in the middle of winter and had to sleep on the couch for three days.
I tried to impress my friends with my street dance moves at a Queen Street party, but tripped and fell flat on my face.
I forgot to cancel my gym membership and ended up paying for it every month without using it.
I went to a live music show in Little Italy and spilled my drink on the band. They were not amused.
I tried to ride a bike on Lake Shore Boulevard and ended up stuck in traffic for an hour.
I attended a drag show in Queen West and accidentally called the performer by the wrong name the entire night.
I bought a map of Toronto to show my tourist friend, but I couldn't read it myself and we got lost for hours.
I went ice skating at Nathan Phillips Square and fell into the pond during a crowded session.
I tried to take a shortcut through a construction site and got stuck behind a pile of gravel for 20 minutes.
I ordered a fancy latte to impress my coworker, but the barista spelled my name wrong. We laughed it off, but it was still cringe.
I attempted to navigate through Yonge-Dundas Square on rollerblades and collided with a street performer.
I mistook a homeless person's belongings for mine in the morning rush and returned their stuff to the wrong location.
I tried to join a local Toronto trivia night, but knew nothing about the city's history. Got all the answers wrong.
I attended a Polar Bear Swim and realized I forgot to bring a towel. Had to run home immediately.
I got lost in the Toronto Islands and ended up spending the night camping alone.
I tried to pet a stray cat near the University of Toronto, but it scratched me fiercely. Now I'm banned from the area.
I went to a downtown art gallery opening and accidentally spilled red wine on an abstract painting.
I attempted to parallel park on Queen Street and ended up scraping my bumper against another car.
I thought I was entering a free sample station at St. Lawrence Market, but it was actually a high-end product demo.
